Sona is better off since the most recent change, but she still has room to improve.  Generally you have a good level 1, then your early to mid game is totally based off how well your ally(s) pressure the lane.  Sona is a horrible sustain champion, and isn't even that impressive of a lane bully without a hyper aggressive ADC backing her.

I would still love to see some more power put into her heal, or at least a longer duration of the shield.

As for her movement speed ability.... that thing is still a mess.  Ranks up poorly, doesn't last long enough to help your allies much, the power cord off it is often not enough to matter in regards to catching or escaping an enemy.

I don't think she is actually one of the better healers.  She is just one of the few characters were throwing out your heal when ever it's up (assuming you have the mana regen to do so) is actually a decent idea.  Your heal is one of if not THE worst heals in the game, the numbers tend to look good because you are throwing out heal after heal, after heal so long as your mana holds out.  Also her heal benefits a lot from the usual build path of a metric ton of AP, is you build her with very little AP the heal does jack all.


I personally think a small time buff to her shield is not that big of a power spike.  If you don't boost the amounts just the duration, it doesn't do that much in regards to keeping your allies alive, simply removes a bit of the micro management needed to actually use the shield.

One thing i would love to see is a buff up to about 500 range on the utility aspects of her abilities.  The extra range would go a long way in keeping Sona a little less prone to AOE counters when attempting to assist her teammates.  I still think a low base health pool, low base defense, and a bottom tier movement speed are enough build in counters to an "aura" based champion, even if the aura's are slightly bigger then their current incarnations.

> [{quoted}](name=A Vitriolic Cat,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ab1sfOlt,comment-id=00000001000100000000,timestamp=2015-11-26T23:17:55.680+0000)

Because other support champions totally lack a big wombo team fight ultimate. I mean it's not like {{champion:267}} ,{{champion:201}} , {{champion:89}}  exist. 

Sona's damage really isn't all that impressive.  People wouldn't complain if they kept getting chunked down because they let an ADC keep unloading auto attacks and damage abilities on them,  so why is it all of a sudden an issue when the support can output some good damage with an auto attack?

Okay, let's look at this setup though. Nami's teamfight ultimate is much harder to use in a lot of scenarios then Sona's (since it moves much slower but has longer range this is mostly arguable, but I feel like there's a lot more counterplay to dodging it). Nami's kit is also not that of an aura/sustain support as much as it is a skirmishing support - she DOES have a heal but healing is definitely not the brunt of her kit. She's intended to fight the enemy laner, using the heal as a health swing during a skirmish (since it bounces around dealing damage and heals). These things work together.

Braum and Leona we won't even talk about (I NEVER SAID SUPPORTS CAN'T HAVE WOMBO/TEAMFIGHT ULTIMATES, but that  it doesn't fit on an AURA/SUSTAIN support like Sona, which none of the champs you listed are).

Currently Sona has a kit that favors short trades with breaks in between to heal back up, looking for good opportunities to counter an opponent moving out of position. She does well in teamfights (even with just QWE) by giving her auras to her team and providing shields, healing, and some damage amp in the form of Q procs for her team. And then she has a random AoE 1.5 second stun. Her kit (which is great for sieging minus the ultimate) has a random huge teamfight CD attached to it. On someone like Nami it makes more sense - she has her Q, it combos together into her R, but her healing is much weaker than Sona's and she doesn't offer quite the same amount of teamwide utility (yeah she gives movespeed, but Sona does too and hers is easier to utilize on a wider range of people, barring Nami's ultimate). I really, really wish that Sona had a permutation of a Karma ultimate, either where you entered a state where your auras were empowered and your spells worked differently for -x- amount of seconds, preserving her aura/sustain feel while giving her a clear increase in power for those clutch teamfight plays - or they gave her an evolving ability mechanic with her ult instead of the current flat buff to everything for each rank in ult. Allow Sona some decision making while removing some of the hidden power from her kit, and she suddenly becomes much less oppressive to play against. People complain a lot about Sona but I feel like she's way less annoying to lane against than Soraka with the caveat that Soraka doesn't have a big AoE stun as her ult.

There are so many points of this that i either just disagree or would claim you are just wrong about.  She is not a good siege champion, her abilities other then her passive have no effect buildings.  Her heal is really lack luster, lacking the base numbers to really do much of anything to help your team mate until you are rolling in the late game with 200-400 AP.

Also Sona has moved so far away from the old aura sustain build that it's more or less pointless to even mention it now.  Her current kit is not aura's it's a thrown together chimera of one time bonuses, many of which don't last long enough to see full effect.

It always amuses me that people complain about Sona, she is actually super easy to play against if you can even remotely pick up your opponents pattern.  So much of Sona's damage is based off your opponents letting you get in free hits.  It is very rare that the creep wave is going to be in a place where Sona can land her Q into AA without being open to counter poke or getting caught by an ability.  Late game a ton of her power simply comes from building a ton of inflated damage.  One doesn't complain when the Ziggs with {{item:3100}} and 300-600 AP is auto attacking for metric tons of damage, so why is it an issue when Sona does it?

While we are talking about her ultimate though, what do you think would be a good replacement?  Because as Sona stands it's basically 40-70% of her reason for existing in the late game.  Remember that without a damage ability for an ultimate she has 1 offensive based skill, while still being one of the most fragile champions in the game.  Also remember that without the stun part of her ultimate, she is the only support without a built in form of CC.  Hell even Soraka has a built in root AND slow in her basic kit.  Sona has to use her passive to even get a slow.

Sona is good for sieging because she has a short CD ability that gives everyone on her team a shield and heals herself and a target. If you can't understand why that's useful when you're trying to take a tower then I can't help you. And I'm not complaining about Sona - I'm a Sona main that's sad that she's so incredibly binary when her kit could be much more interesting than it is, so I think you're coming at me from the wrong angle here. I also don't feel like you read my post as I gave two examples of abilities to replace her ultimate with. Sona also has a slow, basically a mini-exhaust (Diminuendo is SUPER good) and additional utility with her E and W. If you don't consider her passive "built in" CC I, again, don't know how to help you. I think you're looking at Sona from a very binary perspective (only useful combo is Q->powerchord empowered AA, etc) and these are just incorrect. Superior poke combo in basically all situations is E powerchord Q AA as you retain the MS buff for long enough to easily weave back out.

a 40% movement reduction for 2 second, based on having cast at least 3 abilities and the last abliity cast was your E, with a 12 second base cooldown on the ability.  All that while also being within auto attack range, no i would not call that a good built in form of Crowd Control.

As for the damage reduction modifier, it's ok but it's hardly an exhaust.  You can't surprise opponents with it most times and the auto attack range on it makes it hard to use while running away from a target.  Add that the effect is not super visual and often it's not clear if/why a character is doing less damage.

As for your poke concept that implies a minimum level of 2 to have both the movement speed and damage abilities, or likely level 4 since basically no on goes damage into movement speed.  It also is a huge mana sink, costing about 100-125 per poke, requires you to wait between each poke till your movement speed buff is active again (12 second base cooldown), and still usually requires your opponents to not learn your attack pattern and/or catch you out of position when you go in to poke.

40% movement reduction is stronger than Rylai's, and the base CD may be high but you can easily (and efficiently) hit max CDR. W is literally an exhaust - with about 300 AP it's 30% damage reduction, while exh is 40% on a summoner spell.

You are overlooking and minimizing a TON of the utility that Sona's kit brings.

Her base numbers are horrible if you take a typical team buff item patch with minimal AP, even at max CDR you aren't going to be doing next to anything if you have under 200 AP, unless you count your ultimate.

On the flip side she is a joke of a mage character.  1 offensive ability that is heavily front loaded with needing to be in auto attack range to function, a very small heal / shield, and a short term movement speed buff to try and compansate for her horrible base movement speed.  No hard or lasting CC to make trades.  And most fun a horrible ability to clear waves.

EVERY good support has aoe cc in some fashion that's quick to use to make plays with, save Soraka who only spams W and wins since win starts with W.

One really can't change Sona's R without uprooting the whole kit, especially if changing R meant not having an aoe stun. It's literally that important to Sona's overall kit.

Also, if anything, Sona's good for sieging when she combines Lich with her passive. THAT'S why she helps sieging more than other supports (combined with the shield, anyway). Nothing's more helpful when taking down a turret in the mid/late game than a free 400-500 damage shot out of nowhere. You're not wrong, but her synergy with Lich is a better point to make.

With more power funneled into the rest of her kit as the hulking power budget monstrosity that is her ultimate is removed, will she even need hard CC to be an effective support? Changes don't happen in a vacuum.

also, Karma is really strong right now. So... Your argument is kinda strange. There are plenty of viable supports that don't bring huge AoE hard CC (Nautilus could be argued to really only have single target CC and he was spammed quite a bit in worlds), and there are definitely supports whose power doesn't rely on their hard CC but on other parts of their kit (Soraka being a prime example, but I think supports like Lulu deserve a mention as well - while her ultimate DOES have a knockup, that's not really the primary strength of the ability.)
